LayoutNode.Content: 17th International European Conference on Parallel and Distributed Computing
LayoutNode.SRC: 17th International European Conference on Parallel and Distributed Computing

LayoutNode.Content: Euro-Par is an annual series of international conferences dedicated to the promotion and advancement of all aspects of parallel and distributed computing. Euro-Par focuses on all aspects of hardware, software, algorithms and applications in this field. The objective of Euro-Par is to provide a forum for the promotion of parallel and distributed computing both as an industrial technique and an academic discipline, extending the frontier of both the state of the art and the state of the practice.
LayoutNode.SRC: Euro-Par is an annual series of international conferences dedicated to the promotion and advancement of all aspects of parallel and distributed computing. Euro-Par focuses on all aspects of hardware, software, algorithms and applications in this field. The objective of Euro-Par is to provide a forum for the promotion of parallel and distributed computing both as an industrial technique and an academic discipline, extending the frontier of both the state of the art and the state of the practice.

LayoutNode.Content: The following topics will be covered by regular Euro-Par 2011 sessions:
LayoutNode.SRC: The following topics will be covered by regular Euro-Par 2011 sessions:

LayoutNode.Content: Theory and Algorithms for Parallel Computation

Full details on the topics, including topic descriptions and chairs, are available on the Euro-Par 2011 website (europar2011.bordeaux.inria.fr). The conference will feature tutorials and invited talks. Co-located workshops are also planned.
LayoutNode.SRC: Full details on the topics, including topic descriptions and chairs, are available on the Euro-Par 2011 website (europar2011.bordeaux.inria.fr). The conference will feature tutorials and invited talks. Co-located workshops are also planned.

LayoutNode.Content: Full papers should not exceed 12 pages in the Springer LNCS style. Paper submission has to be performed electronically via the conference website in PDF format. Papers accepted for publication must also be supplied in source form (LaTeX or Word).
LayoutNode.SRC: Full papers should not exceed 12 pages in the Springer LNCS style. Paper submission has to be performed electronically via the conference website in PDF format. Papers accepted for publication must also be supplied in source form (LaTeX or Word).

LayoutNode.Content: The 12 pages limit is a hard limit. It includes everything (text, figures, references) and will be strictly enforced by the EDAS submission system.
LayoutNode.SRC: The 12 pages limit is a hard limit. It includes everything (text, figures, references) and will be strictly enforced by the EDAS submission system.

LayoutNode.Content: Papers must offer original contributions regarding the theory and practice of parallel and distributed computing. Full submission guidelines are available on the conference website. Only contributions not submitted elsewhere for publication will be considered.
LayoutNode.SRC: Papers must offer original contributions regarding the theory and practice of parallel and distributed computing. Full submission guidelines are available on the conference website. Only contributions not submitted elsewhere for publication will be considered.

LayoutNode.Content: Authors must submit their papers to the specific topic they judge most appropriate. Details on the topics, including descriptions and chairs, are available on the conference website.
LayoutNode.SRC: Authors must submit their papers to the specific topic they judge most appropriate. Details on the topics, including descriptions and chairs, are available on the conference website.

LayoutNode.Content: All accepted papers will be included in the conference proceedings, published by Springer in the LNCS series. Authors of accepted papers will be requested to sign a Springer copyright form.
LayoutNode.SRC: All accepted papers will be included in the conference proceedings, published by Springer in the LNCS series. Authors of accepted papers will be requested to sign a Springer copyright form.

LayoutNode.Content: Euro-Par 2011 is organized by National Institute for Research in Computer Science and Control (INRIA), the University of Bordeaux I and the French National Centre for Scientific Research (CNRS).
LayoutNode.SRC: Euro-Par 2011 is organized by National Institute for Research in Computer Science and Control (INRIA), the University of Bordeaux I and the French National Centre for Scientific Research (CNRS).

LayoutNode.Content: The Euro-Par 2011 conference will be held on the campus of Bordeaux II University, Place de la Victoire, in the center of Bordeaux.
LayoutNode.SRC: The Euro-Par 2011 conference will be held on the campus of Bordeaux II University, Place de la Victoire, in the center of Bordeaux.

LayoutNode.Content: Bordeaux is the largest city of the Aquitaine Region in South-West of France. It is known worldwide for its vineyards, chateaux, gastronomy and historical places.
LayoutNode.SRC: Bordeaux is the largest city of the Aquitaine Region in South-West of France. It is known worldwide for its vineyards, chateaux, gastronomy and historical places.

LayoutNode.Content: Traveling to Bordeaux is very easy. Bordeaux hosts an international airport with connections to major cities in Europe (such as Rome, Amsterdam, London, Madrid, Dublin or Stockholm) as well as Paris and other cities in France. It is also directly connected to Paris by the high-speed TGV train.
